summary: This is an email chain from May 27, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel discussing a video clip (clip I.MOV) related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The email references a transcript passage from a prosecution memo where an individual denies ever giving massages to anyone, including Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Sender of the email stating 'This is good' in response to receiving a video clip related to the Maxwell case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced in the quoted transcript passage where an individual denies ever giving him a massage.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The case referenced in the email subject line is related to her, and the clip is presumably evidence in her prosecution.

connections.description: Maxwell is a co-defendant in the case related to Epstein's activities, as indicated by the email subject referencing 'Maxwell Clip'.

events.title: Email exchange regarding Maxwell evidence clip
events.description: Prosecutors exchange emails about a video clip (clip I.MOV) that corresponds to a transcript passage from a prosecution memo where a witness denies giving massages.

keyFacts: The email discusses a video clip (clip I.MOV) that is evidence in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The clip corresponds to a transcript passage where an individual testifies they never gave a massage to anyone, including Jeffrey Epstein.
The email is dated May 27, 2020, and involves U.S. Attorney's Office personnel coordinating evidence.
The subject line indicates this is 'Email 1 of 11', suggesting a series of communications about the clip.
